result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen Gene Mc Cuen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Allen Gene Mc Cuen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Allen Gene Mc Cuen was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

filed by Atty Helgeson

11:36 AM Defendant Allen Gene Mc Cuen appeared by zoom.  Attorney Philip A. Helgeson in court for Allen Gene Mc Cuen.  Attorney Kaley Walker in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CF115, 22CF94. ADA Walker: guilty to Ct#1 in 22CF15 impose 10 years prison- 5 years IC and 5 years ES stayed w/3 years probation: successful completion of treatment court, $3323.17 restitution  joint/several with Melissa Teegarden, court costs ($518). Dismiss Ct#2 in 22CF15 and 22CF94. Atty Helgeson and Def agree. Court goes over Def's right to personal appearance; Def waives that right and wishes to proceed via zoom. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def -Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 in 22CF15. Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds defendant guilty to Ct#1 in 22CF15. Court dismisses Ct#2 in 22CF15 and 22CF94. ADA Walker and Atty Helgeson address sentencing- joint recommendation. Victim's rights are in compliance. Defendant addresses the court.  Court imposes 10 years prison- 5 years initial incarceration  w/ 5 years ES, stayed, orders 3 years probation; concurrent to current probation- court costs ($518). restitution $3323.17 w/ 10% surcharge joint/several with Melissa Teegarden, successful completion of treatment court, Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. 120 days conditional jail- stayed to be used at the agent and/or treatment court's discretion. Provide DNA sample within 30 days. 0 days credit if probation is revoked. Eligible for the CIP and SAP immediately but cannot be released until 75% of sentence has been completed. Appeal rights are given to the defendant.  11:58
signed by Allen McCuen and Atty Helgeson

10:32 AM Defendant Allen Gene Mc Cuen in court.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared in court with Def. Def does not qualify for the PD.   Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reviews Defendant's information.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint. Walker: $25,000 signature bond with no contact with EMS or his residence. Nelson: no objection. Court orders as requested. Court sets a status with Ct Comm to ensure Def has counsel.  Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
